metadata.title: CVE-2019-20807 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
In Vim before 8.1.0881, users can circumvent the rvim restricted mode andexecute arbitrary OS commands via scripting interfaces (e.g., Python, Ruby,or Lua).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-athena - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-gtk - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-gui-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-nox - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-runtime - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
vim-tiny - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
xxd - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5').
